comments.comment: Seems like @cached_property is not working here?

The cached_property was saving to : f'CACHED_{self.func.__name__}' but retrieving from : self.func.__name__ So you need to make sure that you save and read from the same attribute Here you go. <denchmark-code>class cached_property(object): def __init__(self, func): self.func = func
def __get__(self, obj, cls): cached_value = obj.__dict__.get(f'CACHED_{self.func.__name__}') if cached_value is not None: return cached_value
value = obj.__dict__[f'CACHED_{self.func.__name__}'] = self.func(obj) return value </denchmark-code>
or <denchmark-code>class cached_property(object): def __init__(self, func): self.func = func
def __get__(self, obj, cls): if obj is None: return self
value = obj.__dict__[self.func.__name__] = self.func(obj) return value </denchmark-code>
Sorry about the formatting of the comment.
